about_the_game:
This is a Breakout/Pinball type videogame.

You must keep track of the Crazy Brain while attempting to Gather points and collect an  accumulated score and attempting to exit stage before failing.

Includes:

23 Unique Stages

1 Large Tower Stage

Four Modes:

-Consecutive Mode

-Marathon Mode

-Tower Mode

-Solo Stage Mode



 Learn when to boost and when not to boost

Accumulate Score without failing.

The Crazy Brain must enter the goal to collect score.

HOW TO PLAY:

1. When the Crazy Brain enters the goal

the stage run finishes.

try not to enter the goal too soon.

hold back and take risks for more points.

2. Press the "space bar" to charge

the VHS TAPE paddle

to multiply your potential score.

the charge only lasts for a split second,

so timing is required to achieve this.

3. Use Left Flipper with "S"

Use RIGHT Flipper with "ENTER".

Set the Position of each flipper Strategically

by Rapidly Pressing "S" or "ENTER".

4. Move the VHS tape paddle with "a" or "d"

to rebound the Crazy Brain,

block Crazy Brain, or

get out of the way of the Crazy Brain.

5. Press "P" at your own risk

to multiply your potential score.

pressing "p" causes both Crazy Brain

to pick up speed

rapidly.

6. Pressing "p" can be used

when a Crazy Brain is stagnant or too slow.

*Pressing "p" strategically is crucial.

content_descriptors.notes: Contains pixelated blood, skulls, skeletons and various fleshy things.

detailed_description:
This is a Breakout/Pinball type videogame.

You must keep track of the Crazy Brain while attempting to Gather points and collect an  accumulated score and attempting to exit stage before failing.

Includes:

23 Unique Stages

1 Large Tower Stage

Four Modes:

-Consecutive Mode

-Marathon Mode

-Tower Mode

-Solo Stage Mode



 Learn when to boost and when not to boost

Accumulate Score without failing.

The Crazy Brain must enter the goal to collect score.

HOW TO PLAY:

1. When the Crazy Brain enters the goal

the stage run finishes.

try not to enter the goal too soon.

hold back and take risks for more points.

2. Press the "space bar" to charge

the VHS TAPE paddle

to multiply your potential score.

the charge only lasts for a split second,

so timing is required to achieve this.

3. Use Left Flipper with "S"

Use RIGHT Flipper with "ENTER".

Set the Position of each flipper Strategically

by Rapidly Pressing "S" or "ENTER".

4. Move the VHS tape paddle with "a" or "d"

to rebound the Crazy Brain,

block Crazy Brain, or

to pick up speed

rapidly.

6. Pressing "p" can be used

when a Crazy Brain is stagnant or too slow.

*Pressing "p" strategically is crucial.
legal_notice:
This game was made with the intellectual property and creative assets created and owned by Artist, James H. Van der Meulen.
Copyright regarding the Art, Characters, World and Story of this Game belongs to James H. Van der Meulen.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Debian, Ubuntu, Arch, Steam OS
  • Processor: 3rd Generation Intel Processor or AMD equivalent
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 1GB Dedicated Graphics Card
  • Storage: 200 MB available space
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Debian, Ubuntu, Arch, Steam OS
  • Processor: 10th Generation Intel Processor or AMD equivalent
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 2GB Dedicated Graphics Card
  • Storage: 200 MB available space

name: Crazy Brain

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: 3rd Generation Intel Processor or AMD equivalent
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 1GB Dedicated Graphics Card
  • Storage: 200 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 11
  • Processor: 10th Generation Intel Processor or AMD equivalent
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 2GB Dedicated Graphics Card
  • Storage: 200 MB available space

short_description: When to boost and when not to boost? That is the question.
